verses.verse: Why <WH6256>, seeing times are not hidden <WH6845> from the Almighty <WH7706>, do they that know <WH3045> him not see <WH2372> his days <WH3117>?
Some remove <WH5381> the landmarks <WH1367>; they violently take away <WH1497> flocks <WH5739>, and feed there <WH7462>.
They drive away <WH5090> the donkey <WH2543> of the fatherless <WH3490>, they take <WH2254> the widow <WH490>'s ox <WH7794> for a pledge <WH2254>.
They turn <WH5186> the needy <WH34> out of the way <WH1870>: the poor <WH6041> of the earth <WH776> hide <WH2244> themselves together <WH3162>.

Behold <WH6501>, as wild donkeys in the desert <WH4057>, go they forth <WH3318> to their work <WH6467>; rising some time <WH7836> for a prey <WH2964>: the wilderness <WH6160> yields food <WH3899> for them and for their sons <WH5288>.
They reap <WH7114> every one his corn <WH1098> in the field <WH7704>: and they gather <WH3953> the vintage <WH3754> of the wicked <WH7563>.
They cause the naked <WH6174> to lodge <WH3885> without clothing <WH3830>, that they have no covering <WH3682> in the cold <WH7135>.
They are wet <WH7372> with the showers <WH2230> of the mountains <WH2022>, and embrace <WH2263> the rock <WH6697> for want of a shelter <WH4268>.
They pluck <WH1497> the fatherless <WH3490> from the breast <WH7699>, and take a pledge <WH2254> of the poor <WH6041>.
They cause him to go <WH1980> naked <WH6174> without clothing <WH3830>, and they take away <WH5375> the sheaf <WH6016> from the hungry <WH7457>;
Which make oil <WH6671> inside <WH996> their walls <WH7791>, and tread <WH1869> their winepresses <WH3342>, and suffer thirst <WH6770>.
Men <WH4962> groan <WH5008> from out of the city <WH5892>, and the soul <WH5315> of the wounded <WH2491> cries out <WH7768>: yet God <WH433> lays <WH7760> not wickedness to them <WH8604>.
They are of those that rebel <WH4775> against the light <WH216>; they know <WH5234> not the ways <WH1870> there <WH3427>, nor stay in the paths there <WH5410>.
The murderer <WH7523> rising <WH6965> with the light <WH216> kills <WH6991> the poor <WH6041> and needy <WH34>, and in the night <WH3915> is as a thief <WH1590>.
The eye <WH5869> also of the adulterer <WH5003> waits <WH8104> for the twilight <WH5399>, saying <WH559>, No eye <WH5869> shall see <WH7789> me <WH5643>: and disguises his face <WH6440>.
In the dark <WH2822> they dig through <WH2864> houses <WH1004>, which they had marked <WH2856> for themselves in the daytime <WH3119>: they know <WH3045> not the light <WH216>.
For the morning <WH1242> is to them even as <WH3162> the shadow of death <WH6757>: if one know <WH5234> them <WH1091>, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death <WH6757>.
He is swift <WH7031> as the waters <WH6440>; their portion <WH2513> is cursed <WH7043> in the earth <WH776>: he beholds <WH6437> not the way <WH1870> of the vineyards <WH3754>.
Drought <WH6723> and heat <WH2527> consume <WH1497> the snow <WH7950> waters <WH4325>: so does the grave <WH7585> those which have sinned <WH2398>.

The womb <WH7358> shall forget <WH7911> him <WH7415>; the worm shall feed sweetly <WH4988> on him <WH2142>; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness <WH5766> shall be broken <WH7665> as a tree <WH6086>.
He evil entreats <WH7462> the childless <WH6135> that bears <WH3205> not <WH3190>: and does not good to the widow <WH490>.
He draws <WH4900> also the mighty <WH47> with his power <WH3581>: he rises up <WH6965>, and no man is sure <WH539> of life <WH2416>.
Though it be given <WH5414> him to be in safety <WH983>, whereon he rests <WH8172>; yet his eyes <WH5869> are upon their ways <WH1870>.

They are exalted <WH7426> for a little while <WH4592>, but are gone and brought low <WH4355>; they are taken out <WH7092> of the way <WH1870> as all other <WH5243>, and cut off as the tops <WH7218> of the ears of corn <WH7641>.
And if it be not so now <WH645>, who will make <WH7760> me a liar <WH3576>, and make <WH7760> my speech <WH4405> nothing worth <WH408>?
